And … Roam with Mastodon is now available for Firefox!

https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/roam-with-mastodon/

- Follow and boost people on other Mastodon servers with one click

- Share interesting links and sites

- Schedule posts for later

(Chrome/Arc extension is here https://fo.llow.social/roam/add-to-chrome)

#Mastodon #Firefox #Chrome

content.html:
Blog: Programmatically Creating Embulk Configuration Files

Embulk needs a YAML file configuration for each data load. It’s a simple format, very human-readable. But there are cases where I want the YAML files to generate dynamically. Embulk does support an experimental feature that involves liquid templates. But my team is well versed in Python and Jinja2. Hence that is what we use.

https://thejeshgn.com/2022/12/28/programmatically-creating-embulk-configuration-files/
content.value:
Blog: Programmatically Creating Embulk Configuration Files
Embulk needs a YAML file configuration for each data load. It’s a simple format, very human-readable. But there are cases where I want the YAML files to generate dynamically. Embulk does support an experimental feature that involves liquid templates. But my team is well versed in Python and Jinja2. Hence that is what we use.

content.html: Starting today, @Techmeme and @Mediagazer editors are now seeing @-mentions you make here, via Mastodon's notifications API. So if you want to tip us on a news link, or have excellent, pithy commentary, add @Techmeme to the end of your post and we may act on it. (We won't reply directly, but we'll see it!) We'll also see replies to our posts, since replies are @-mentions too!
content.value: Starting today, @Techmeme and @Mediagazer editors are now seeing @-mentions you make here, via Mastodon's notifications API. So if you want to tip us on a news link, or have excellent, pithy commentary, add @Techmeme to the end of your post and we may act on it. (We won't reply directly, but we'll see it!) We'll also see replies to our posts, since replies are @-mentions too!

content.html:
And

Reports in Russian media said Mr Antov, 65, had fallen from a window at the hotel in the city of Rayagada on Sunday. Another member of his four-strong Russian group, Vladimir Budanov, died at the hotel on Friday.

Superintendent Vivekananda Sharma of Odisha police said Mr Budanov was found to have suffered a stroke while his friend "was depressed after his death and he too died". The Russian consul in Kolkata, Alexei Idamkin, told the Tass news agency that police did not see a "criminal element in these tragic events".

https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-64101437

content.html:
The thing that is wild to me is that the vast majority of people who know me on this app are “new”.

Like I can totally reinvent myself. We are just going to gloss over the public speaking Kris Nóva and the kernel hacker Kris Nóva and the Kubernetes Kris Nóva and the naked on the beach Kris Nóva and just go straight into entrepreneur and technical leader version of myself and honestly I’m okay with Nova 4.0

Please to meet you all. Maybe I should do my own #Hachyderm #Introduction thread?

We are just going to gloss over the public speaking Kris Nóva and the kernel hacker Kris Nóva and the Kubernetes Kris Nóva and the naked on the beach Kris Nóva and just go straight into entrepreneur and technical leader version of myself and honestly I’m okay with Nova 4.0Please to meet you all. content.html:
DEFCON.social is now open - no more invite codes needed!

With the fix (🤞) to the federated image cache our new 30TB Block Storage server seems to be happy.

Next up we will enable search - just deciding between Elastic Search or Open Search, so any opinions welcome.
#MastoAdmin

content.html:
Over the last few days, I experimented with moving my Twitter archive to my personal #Mastodon account @luca@social.luca.run and finally succeeded.

I had to modify the Mastodon source to allow backdated posts and prevent it from spamming other instances with old posts. Because image descriptions aren't included in the Twitter export, I had to request them from the API. There I got full text for truncated Retweets as well.

Incomplete notes:
https://github.com/lucahammer/fediporter

#TwitterMigration #MastoAdmin
content.value: Over the last few days, I experimented with moving my Twitter archive to my personal #Mastodon account @luca@social.luca.run and finally succeeded.I had to modify the Mastodon source to allow backdated posts and prevent it from spamming other instances with old posts. Because image descriptions aren't included in the Twitter export, I had to request them from the API. There I got full text for truncated Retweets as well.Incomplete notes:https://github.com/lucahammer/fediporter#TwitterMigration #MastoAdmin

content.html:
How the Dutch sold Tamils into slavery in Scandinavia and the story of one man’s escape to freedom

In the 17th century, the Danish set up a trading post in the village of Tranquebar on Tamil Nadu’s Coromandel Coast and supplied servants to aristocrats.

#colonialism #slavery #tamilnadu #dutch #danish #history #MastIndia #india

https://scroll.in/article/1038523/how-the-dutch-sold-tamils-into-slavery-in-scandinavia-and-the-story-of-one-mans-escape-to-freedom

content.html:
Economic review on the state of tech. Mentions tech exceptionalism has come to an end due to competition. The idea of leveling the playing field, and smaller decentralized efforts makes me happy.

My hope is that Aurae is able to disrupt cloud, and prove that consolidation can be broken. The recent migration to the fediverse has me convinced that breaking up the tech giants is the future.

https://www.economist.com/business/2022/12/24/how-techs-defiance-of-economic-gravity-came-to-an-abrupt-end
content.value: Economic review on the state of tech. Mentions tech exceptionalism has come to an end due to competition. The idea of leveling the playing field, and smaller decentralized efforts makes me happy.My hope is that Aurae is able to disrupt cloud, and prove that consolidation can be broken. The recent migration to the fediverse has me convinced that breaking up the tech giants is the future.https://www.economist.com/business/2022/12/24/how-techs-defiance-of-economic-gravity-came-to-an-abrupt-end

content.html:
If you ever wondered why “text” sounds like the word “textile”, it’s because the former comes from the latter.

I find this very satisfying. Telling a yarn, weaving words, making a metaphorical textile.

Webster’s dictionary, indeed.

Webster means weaver. A person named Webster made a dictionary. Nominative determinism of a different sort?

https://www.etymonline.com/word/Text
content.value: If you ever wondered why “text” sounds like the word “textile”, it’s because the former comes from the latter. I find this very satisfying. Telling a yarn, weaving words, making a metaphorical textile. Webster’s dictionary, indeed. Webster means weaver. A person named Webster made a dictionary. Nominative determinism of a different sort?https://www.etymonline.com/word/Text

content.html:
I’ll try again, this time with hashtags:

I want to commission a 3D artist to create some models suitable for 3D printing / CAD / CNC (not necessarily for nice 3D renders). I’d also like to release the models open source / Creative Commons once they’re done. I don’t really know how to get started with finding someone, does anyone have any recommendations? #art #commission #CAD #3D #CNC #3dprinting

The models would be of “Spomenik” monuments:
https://www.spomenikdatabase.org/photo-directory

content.html:
Merry Christmas.Twitter APIs have been abused and data is now being sold. Consider your account security. Especially if you are coming from Twitter and maybe… just maybe… don't have the best security practice there. I doubt this is the last we see of these types of events.

The data is now being sold online.

Twitter data breach: +400m users. https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=34125843

Especially if you are coming from Twitter and maybe… just maybe… don't have the best security practice there. I doubt this is the last we see of these types of events.The data is now being sold online.Twitter data breach: +400m users. https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=34125843

content.html:
He talked about electric cars. I don't know anything about cars, so when people said he was a genius I figured he must be a genius.

Then he talked about rockets. I don't know anything about rockets, so when people said he was a genius I figured he must be a genius.

Now he talks about software. I happen to know a lot about software & Elon Musk is saying the stupidest shit I've ever heard anyone say, so when people say he's a genius I figure I should stay the hell away from his cars and rockets.
content.value: He talked about electric cars. I don't know anything about cars, so when people said he was a genius I figured he must be a genius.Then he talked about rockets. I don't know anything about rockets, so when people said he was a genius I figured he must be a genius.Now he talks about software. I happen to know a lot about software & Elon Musk is saying the stupidest shit I've ever heard anyone say, so when people say he's a genius I figure I should stay the hell away from his cars and rockets.

content.html:
One of the things I would miss here on Mastodon was all of the alerts from my local infrastructure and government twitter accounts. These will likely take a very long time to make the migration.

With https://bird.makeup, you can create bot accounts that put those tweets in your Mastodon timeline. For instance, I follow the Washington State Patrol account for regional weather related road closures and accident reports:

@wspd7pio
content.value: One of the things I would miss here on Mastodon was all of the alerts from my local infrastructure and government twitter accounts. These will likely take a very long time to make the migration. With https://bird.makeup, you can create bot accounts that put those tweets in your Mastodon timeline. For instance, I follow the Washington State Patrol account for regional weather related road closures and accident reports:@wspd7pio
